summary: This document is an email chain from November 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff, scheduling a meeting to discuss the Epstein case. It includes a substantive update about a meeting in California with a potential victim, noting the inability to bring an enticement charge and the victim's indecision about pursuing a criminal case.

events.title: California Meeting with Potential Victim
events.description: A meeting was held in California with a potential victim. It was determined an enticement charge could not be brought due to timing/location facts. The victim was unsure about pursuing a criminal case and did not want to discuss specific conduct.

events.title: Scheduled Limited Proffer
events.description: A person (likely a witness or victim) is scheduled to come in for a limited proffer to discuss her background.

keyFacts: Prosecutors met with a potential victim in California but determined an enticement charge was not viable based on timing and location facts.
The potential victim was still undecided about pursuing a criminal case and declined to discuss specific conduct during the meeting.
A limited proffer session, focused on background information, was scheduled for a week from Tuesday (November 26, 2019).
The email chain shows active case coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in late 2019.
Multiple names and email addresses are redacted, indicated by placeholders like (USANYS) and <MIMMIE>.
